results.title: The Philadelphia Story
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Loew's Incorporated, Adrian, Waldo Salt, Joseph L. Mankiewicz, George Cukor and Donald Ogden Stewart
results.brief_description: When a rich woman’s ex-husband and a tabloid-type reporter turn up just before her planned remarriage, she begins to learn the truth about herself.

constellations_other.name: Wearing the pants, ladies who lead
constellations_other.description: The pre-code 1932 feature, A Bill of Divorcement, a glass cinema slide of which features in the glass cinema slide display, stars John Barrymore and Katharine Hepburn in her screen debut.

results.title: The Phantom
results.headline_credit: Australia and United States of America, 1996
results.brief_description: The 21st successor to the role of Bengalla’s resident superhero must travel to New York to prevent a rich madman from obtaining three magic skulls that would give him the secret to ultimate power.

constellations_other.name: 1960s television
constellations_other.description: After its debut in the fifties, Australians rapidly became enthusiastic television viewers in the sixties as American imports started to be mixed with notable local productions.

results.description: The 21st successor to the role of Bengalla’s resident superhero must travel to New York to prevent a rich madman from obtaining three magic skulls that would give him the secret to ultimate power.

results.title: The Other Side of the Wind
results.creator_credit: Filip Jan Rymsza, SACI, Les Films de l'Astrophore, Orson Welles, Frank Marshall, Oja Kodar and Dominique Antoine
results.headline_credit: France, Iran and United States of America, 2018
results.brief_description: Surrounded by fans and skeptics, grizzled director J.J. “Jake” Hannaford returns from years abroad in Europe to a changed Hollywood, where he attempts to make his innovative comeback film.

constellations_other.name: George Miller
constellations_other.description: For a guy who started his career as a physician, George Miller sure is a diverse filmmaker.

results.title: The Other Guy
results.brief_description: A successful radio host deals with heartbreak like any young man: binge drinking, offensive behaviour, misuse of Class A substances and sexual entanglements.

results.title: The One-Man Band
results.brief_description: A band-leader has arranged seven chairs for the members of his band. When he sits down in the first chair, a cymbal player appears in the same chair, then rises and sits in the next chair. As the cymbal player sits down, a drummer appears in the second chair, and then likewise moves on to the third chair. In this way, an entire band is soon formed, and is then ready to perform.
results.description: A band-leader has arranged seven chairs for the members of his band. When he sits down in the first chair, a cymbal player appears in the same chair, then rises and sits in the next chair. As the cymbal player sits down, a drummer appears in the second chair, and then likewise moves on to the third chair. In this way, an entire band is soon formed, and is then ready to perform.

results.title: Home of the Blizzard
results.brief_description: Frank Hurley (1885-1962) was firmly established by 1925 as Australia’s most famous photographer. An artist interested less in expressing human experiences than the grandeur of nature and the romance of exotic lands, his work was known to Australians through books, newspaper features and documentary films. His journeys began in December, 1911 when he joined Mawson’s expedition to Antarctica as official photographer; his stills of the Expedition were widely published around the world and this documentary “Home of the Blizzard” was released in 1913.
results.description: Frank Hurley (1885-1962) was firmly established by 1925 as Australia’s most famous photographer. His journeys began in December, 1911 when he joined Mawson’s expedition to Antarctica as official photographer; his stills of the Expedition were widely published around the world and this documentary “Home of the Blizzard” was released in 1913.

results.title: The OA
results.brief_description: Prairie Johnson, blind as a child, comes home seven years after going missing with her sight restored. Some hail her a miracle, others a dangerous mystery, but Prairie won’t talk with the FBI or her parents about where she’s been.

constellations_other.name: Location and exploration
constellations_other.description: A comparative look at location-based gaming and street art and how the way we experience these two art forms has moved out of traditional spaces and onto the street.

results.description: Prairie Johnson, blind as a child, comes home to the community she grew up in with her sight restored. Some hail her a miracle, others a dangerous mystery, but Prairie won’t talk with the FBI or her parents about the seven years she went missing.
description_for_label: Prairie Johnson, blind as a child, comes home to the community she grew up in with her sight restored. Some hail her a miracle, others a dangerous mystery, but Prairie won’t talk with the FBI or her parents about the seven years she went missing.

results.title: The Nightingale
results.creator_credit: Made Up Stories, FilmNation Entertainment, Adelaide Film Festival Investment Fund, Screen Australia, Screen Tasmania, South Australian Film Corporation, Creative Wealth Media Finance, Evans Mark and David Smith
results.headline_credit: Australia, Canada and United States of America, 2019
results.brief_description: In 1825, Claire, a young Irish convict, enlists an Indigenous tracker to chase a British soldier through the rugged Tasmanian wilderness, bent on revenge for a terrible act of violence he committed against her family.

constellations_other.name: David Gulpilil
constellations_other.description: David Gulpilil is a Yolngu man of the Mandhalpuyngu speech of the Djinba language. As a young boy, Gulpilil was an accomplished hunter, tracker and dancer, which he turned into an acclaimed film career that saw him win the Best Actor award at the Cannes Film Festival (for Charlie's Country) and an AACTA for The Tracker, among his many honours.

constellations_other.name: The Australian industry
constellations_other.description: Though our local industry is small, our impact is huge!

constellations_other.name: Inspired design and costume sketches
constellations_other.description: Costume designers Edie Kurzer and Alice Babidge have worked on some of the most acclaimed Australian and international films and TV, joining the ranks of fellow Australians creatives.

constellations_other.name: Landscape as Character
constellations_other.description: The landscape is often a character in Australian films. Usually, it's a villain that represents our problematic national character and is increasingly used to challenge our troubled history and explore our evolving identities.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Made Up Stories, FilmNation Entertainment, Adelaide Film Festival Investment Fund, Screen Australia, Screen Tasmania, South Australian Film Corporation, Creative Wealth Media Finance, Evans Mark and David Smith
results.headline_credit_for_label: Australia, Canada and United States of America, 2019
results.description: In 1825, Clare, a 21-year-old Irish convict, chases a British soldier through the rugged Tasmanian wilderness, bent on revenge for a terrible act of violence he committed against her family. She enlists the services of an Aboriginal tracker who is also marked by trauma from his own violence-filled past.
description_for_label: In 1825, Clare, a 21-year-old Irish convict, chases a British soldier through the rugged Tasmanian wilderness, bent on revenge for a terrible act of violence he committed against her family. She enlists the services of an Aboriginal tracker who is also marked by trauma from his own violence-filled past.

results.title: The Night of the Hunter
results.creator_credit: James Agee, Charles Laughton, Paul Gregory, Paul Gregory Productions and United Artists
results.brief_description: In the Deep South, a serial-killing preacher hunts two young children who know the whereabouts of a stash of money.

constellations_other.name: Welcome to Chechnya: tales through time
constellations_other.description: Documentary Welcome to Chechnya used ground-breaking deep fake technology to hide the identities of LGBTQ+ people fleeing a government-orchestrated genocide in Chechnya.

results.creator_credit_for_label: James Agee, Charles Laughton, Paul Gregory, Paul Gregory Productions and United Artists
results.description: In the Deep South, a serial-killing preacher hunts two young children who know the whereabouts of a stash of money.

results.title: The Neon Demon
results.creator_credit: Vincent Maraval, Nicolas Winding Refn, Amazon Studios, Bold Films, Vendian Entertainment, Space Rocket Nation, Polly Stenham, Mary Laws, Lene Børglum, Sidonie Dumas, Elliott Hostetter, Erin Benach and Esben Bjerring
results.headline_credit: Denmark, France and United States of America, 2016
results.brief_description: When aspiring model Jesse moves to Los Angeles, her youth and vitality are devoured by a group of beauty-obsessed women who will take any means necessary to get what she has.

constellations_other.name: Wild Stallion Mountain: Genre Mash-ups
constellations_other.description: The Bombay Royale are known for combining funk, disco and pop with the sounds of classical Indian music together with the soundtracks of Bollywood cinema. Their music videos similarly hybridise  genres and styles to create intoxicating visual mash-ups.
